skgl

Class KeyInformation

  • java.lang.Object
    • skgl.KeyInformation

  • public final class KeyInformation
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that stores information about a key. Note, if the Valid=false, no more information (creation date, etc) will be stored in the Key Information object.
    Author:
    Artem Los

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KeyInformation(java.util.Date creationDate, java.util.Date expirationDate, int setTime, int timeLeft, boolean[] features, java.lang.String newKey, java.lang.String notes, java.lang.String signature)
      Initialise the Key Information with data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Date CreationDate()
      The date when the key was generated.
      java.util.Date ExpirationDate()
      The specified expiration date.
      boolean[] Features()
      The 8 different features that are stored in the key.
      java.lang.String NewKey()
      In some cases, KeyActivation will return the new key that will be stored in this variable.
      java.lang.String Notes()
      The notes field of a given key.
      int SetTime()
      The number of days a key should be valid.
      java.lang.String Signature()
      When secure option is set to true, this variable will contain the signature of the information that the server returns.
      int TimeLeft()
      The number of days before the key expires.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyInformation

        public KeyInformation(java.util.Date creationDate,
                      java.util.Date expirationDate,
                      int setTime,
                      int timeLeft,
                      boolean[] features,
                      java.lang.String newKey,
                      java.lang.String notes,
                      java.lang.String signature)
        Initialise the Key Information with data.
        Parameters:
        creationDate - The date when the key was generated.
        expirationDate - The specified expiration date.
        setTime - The number of days a key should be valid.
        timeLeft - The number of days before the key expires.
        features - The 8 different features that are stored in the key.
        newKey - In some cases, KeyActivation will return the new key that will be stored in this variable. If there are no changes to the key, the current key will be stored here.
        notes - The notes field of a given key. Make sure to enable access to notes field on http://serialkeymanager.com/Account/Manage.
        signature - When secure option is set to true, this variable will contain the signature of the information that the server returns. It is a signature of almost all variables stored in this variable except for NewKey.

    • Method Detail

      • CreationDate

        public java.util.Date CreationDate()
        The date when the key was generated.
        Returns:
        A Date with CreationDate.

      • ExpirationDate

        public java.util.Date ExpirationDate()
        The specified expiration date.
        Returns:
        A Date with ExpirationDate.

      • SetTime

        public int SetTime()
        The number of days a key should be valid.
        Returns:
        An int with SetTime.

      • TimeLeft

        public int TimeLeft()
        The number of days before the key expires.
        Returns:
        An int with the number of days left.

      • Features

        public boolean[] Features()
        The 8 different features that are stored in the key.
        Returns:
        A boolean array with features.

      • NewKey

        public java.lang.String NewKey()
        In some cases, KeyActivation will return the new key that will be stored in this variable. If there are no changes to the key, the current key will be stored here.
        Returns:
        A string that contains a new key, if applicable.

      • Notes

        public java.lang.String Notes()
        The notes field of a given key. Make sure to enable access to notes field on http://serialkeymanager.com/Account/Manage.
        Returns:
        A string that contains the content of the Notes field.

      • Signature

        public java.lang.String Signature()
        When secure option is set to true, this variable will contain the signature of the information that the server returns. It is a signature of almost all variables stored in this variable except for NewKey.
        Returns:
        A string that contains the signature.
